newsitem.title: USA: Equity Office to buy 11 properties for $144.7 mln.
newsitem.headline: Equity Office to buy 11 properties for $144.7 mln.

text.p: Equity Office Properties said Monday it will buy 11 office properties in suburban Philadelphia for $144.7 million.
The company also said it agreed to buy two office buildings and a parking garage in New Orleans for $140.0 million.

Equity Office said its board approved buying the 11 office properties, which total about one million square feet of office space and have an average occupancy rate of 98.7 percent, from affiliates of the Acorn Development Corp.

The purchase price will be paid in a combination of cash, EOP operating limited partnership units, and the assumption of debt. The cash portion will be funded through Equity Office's working capital and line of credit, it said.

Under the definitive agreement with Columbus American Properties LLC to buy the New Orleans buildings and garage, Equity Office said it will assume $91 million of debt, with $49 million paid in EOP operating limited partnership units at $29 each.
Equity Office is a large publicly traded office building company that owns and operates a portfolio of 90 buildings in 20 states and also owns 14 stand-alone parking facilities.
